newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian castor down on speculative selling.
newsitem.headline: Indian castor down on speculative selling.

text.p: Castorseed June delivery fell to 1,171/1,172 rupees per quintal from 1,177/1,178 rupees on the back of fresh speculative selling, dealers said.

"Sluggish overseas enquiries and improved arrivals triggered fresh bull liquidation, while reports that Brazil has turned an active seller in world markets prompted bear selling in Bombay," one broker said.

Castorseed arrivals in Gujarat rose to 30,000/35,000 bags (75 kg each) against a daily average of 5,000/10,000 bags reported last week. "Arrivals last week were low but have picked up now," one operator said.
Groundnut oil dropped from 355/356 rupees to 353/354 rupees per 10 kgs on demand resistance while inflow was low due to a nationwide strike by transporters.
Imported palm-oil remained steady at 284/285 rupees per 10 kg amid limited activity while fresh arrivals at Bombay port remained at low ebb.
In Rajkot spot groundnut oil was steady at 530/535 rupees per 15 kg.
